article_sub_title: Navigating New Waters: The UK Stablecoin Legal Consultation Framework
content:
The United Kingdom is set to unveil its stablecoin regulatory framework on November 10, 2025, a pivotal moment for financial institutions and digital asset investors alike. Led by the Bank of England (BoE), this consultation aims to align UK regulations with those evolving in the U.S., ensuring compliance and promoting innovation in the burgeoning space of stablecoins. Key highlights include proposed temporary caps on individual holdings at Â£20,000 ($26,350) and a requirement for issuers to maintain substantial liquidity with 40% in BoE deposits and 60% in UK government bonds.

As the UK seeks to balance financial stability with technological advancement, the outcome of this consultation could redefine the role of stablecoins in mainstream finance, ensuring a robust framework that protects consumers while fostering innovation.
